attributes.contentHtml:
Oh shit, Kyoto is back again. Selling nulled licenses.

I don't think you realize @Kyoto , but these nulled licenses may do bad things like:

  1. They can carry viruses, because they're not from an official source, they're from some edgy software crackers from nulled.to, cracked.to or other shitty "hacker" forum/website.
  2. Show unprofessionalism for your business. Nobody likes nulled licenses, do they?
  3. Can ruin buyer's reputation.

    As you see, there are no lifetime/one-time licenses available, and even if they were unless you were a big-ass company throwing money on the roof, you couldn't afford to sell an offer like this.

And you except me to "forget about all these things and be friends" in DMs.
no.

(there might be some grammatical errors in this post, sorry but I'm tired)

attributes.title: Kyoto - FlatIcon wannabe, owns crappy host and "billing" software
